intro: Corchorus hochstetteri, commonly known as the New Zealand kohu, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
